dimcat.analyzer package¶

Submodules¶

dimcat.analyzer.base module¶

Analyzers are PipelineSteps that process data and store the results in Data.processed.

class dimcat.analyzer.base.Analyzer[source]¶

Bases: PipelineStep, ABC

Analyzers are PipelineSteps that process data and store the results in Data.processed.

abstract static aggregate(result_a: R, result_b: R) → R[source]¶

Static method that combines two results of compute().

This needs to be equivalent to calling self.compute on the concatenation of the respective data resulting in the two arguments.

assert_previous_step: Union[str, Collection[str]] = []¶

Analyzer.process_data() raises ValueError if last PipelineStep applied to the _Dataset does not match any of these types.

assert_steps: Union[str, Collection[str]] = []¶

Analyzer.process_data() raises ValueError if at least one of the names does not belong to a PipelineStep that is among the previous PipelineSteps applied to the _Dataset.

abstract static compute(self, **kwargs) → R[source]¶

Static method that performs the actual computation takes place.

config¶

dict This dictionary stores the parameters to be passed to the compute() method.

abstract data_iterator(data: AnalyzedData) → Iterator[Tuple[Union[PieceID, Tuple[str, str, Interval]], Any]][source]¶

How a particular analyzer iterates through a dataset, getting the chunks passed to compute().

excluded_steps: Union[str, Collection[str]] = []¶

Analyzer.process_data() raises ValueError if any of the previous PipelineStep applied to the _Dataset matches one of these types.

group2pandas¶

str The name of the function that allows displaying one group’s results as a single pandas object. See data.Corpus.convert_group2pandas()

level_names¶

dict Define {“indices”: “index_level_name”} if the analysis is applied once per group, because the index of the DataFrame holding the processed data won’t be showing the individual indices anymore.

post_process(processed)[source]¶

Whatever needs to be done after analyzing the data before passing it to the dataset.

process_data(dataset: Dataset) → AnalyzedData[source]¶

Returns an AnalyzedData copy of the Dataset with the added analysis result.

class dimcat.analyzer.facet.ChordSymbolBigrams(dropna=True)[source]¶

Bases: ChordSymbolAnalyzer

Analyzer that returns the bigram counts for all valid chord transitions within a group, ordered by descending frequency.

assert_steps: Union[str, Collection[str]] = ['LocalKeySlicer']¶

Analyzer.process_data() raises ValueError if at least one of the names does not belong to a PipelineStep that is among the previous PipelineSteps applied to the _Dataset.

check(df)[source]¶

Test piece of data for certain properties before computing analysis.

Returns:

  • bool – True if the passed data is eligible.

  • str – Error message in case the passed data is not eligible.

static compute(expanded: DataFrame, dropna: bool = True) → Series[source]¶

Turns the chord column into bigrams and returns their counts in descending order.

Parameters:

  • expanded – Expanded harmony table with the columns localkey and chord.

  • dropna – By default, NaN values are dropped before computing bigrams, resulting in transitions from a missing value’s preceding to its subsequent value. Pass False to include bigrams from and to NaN values.

Returns:

The last two index level are unique (from, to) bigrams, Series values are their corresponding counts.

class dimcat.analyzer.facet.ChordSymbolUnigrams[source]¶

Bases: ChordSymbolAnalyzer

Analyzer that returns the counts of chord symbols for each group, ordered by descending frequency.

static compute(expanded: DataFrame) → Series[source]¶

Computes the value counts of the chord symbol column.

Parameters:

expanded – Expanded harmony labels

Returns:

The last index level has unique chord symbols, Series values are their corresponding counts.

class dimcat.analyzer.facet.NotesAnalyzer[source]¶

result_type = 'NotesResult'¶
class dimcat.analyzer.facet.PitchClassVectors(pitch_class_format='tpc', weight_grace_durations: float = 0.0, normalize=False, ensure_pitch_classes=None, include_empty=False)[source]¶

Bases: NotesAnalyzer

Analyzer that groups notes by their pitch class and aggregates their durations.

static compute(notes: DataFrame, pitch_class_format: Literal['tpc', 'name', 'pc', 'midi'] = 'tpc', weight_grace_durations: float = 0.0, normalize: bool = False, ensure_pitch_classes: Optional[Iterable] = None) → Series[source]¶

Group notes by their pitch class and aggregate their durations.

Parameters:

  • notes – Note table to be transformed into a Pitch Class Vector. The DataFrame needs to contain at least the columns ‘duration_qb’ and ‘tpc’ or ‘midi’, depending on pitch_class_format.

  • pitch_class_format –

    Defines the type of pitch classes to use for the vectors.
    ’tpc’ (default): tonal pitch class, such that -1=F, 0=C, 1=G etc.
    ’name’: tonal pitch class as spelled pitch, e.g. ‘C’, ‘F#’, ‘Abb’ etc.
    ’pc’: chromatic pitch classes where 0=C, 1=C#/Db, … 11=B/Cb.
    ’midi’: original MIDI numbers; the result are pitch vectors, not pitch class vectors.

  • weight_grace_durations – By default (0.), grace notes have duration 0. Set this value to include their weighted durations in the computation of PCVs, e.g. 0.5.

  • normalize – By default, the PCVs contain absolute durations in quarter notes. Pass True to normalize the PCV for each group.

  • ensure_pitch_classes – By default, pitch classes that don’t appear don’t appear. Pass a collection of pitch classes if you want to ensure their presence even if empty. For example, if pitch_class_format='pc' you could pass ensure_columns=range(12).

Returns:

A pitch class vector where the aggregated duration of each pitch class is given in quarter notes or, if normalize=True, as decimal fractions [0.0, 1.0].

filename_factory()[source]¶

Generate file name component based on the configuration.

post_process(processed)[source]¶

Inserts empty pitch class vectors for chunks without pitches, if any.

class dimcat.analyzer.facet.TPCrange[source]¶

Bases: NotesAnalyzer

Computes the range from the minimum to the maximum Tonal Pitch Class (TPC).

static aggregate(result_a: Series, result_b: Series) → Series[source]¶

Static method that combines two results of compute().

This needs to be equivalent to calling self.compute on the concatenation of the respective data resulting in the two arguments.

static compute(notes: DataFrame) → Series[source]¶

Computes the range from the minimum to the maximum Tonal Pitch Class (TPC).

Parameters:

notes – Notes table with the column tpc

Returns:

The difference between the minimal and the maximal tonal pitch class, measured in perfect fifths.
